ray.rage.rendersystem

Interface RenderWindow

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, Visible
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL4RenderWindow

    public interface RenderWindow
extends Visible, Disposable
    A render window is what's presented as the main application widget for user interaction.

    Windows contain a drawing surface called a canvas. A canvas is where the results of rendering operations are performed. Windows can also be sub-divided into, and act as containers for, several viewports. Windows have only one viewport by default, but the client application can add more as needed.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Detail

      • createViewport

        Viewport createViewport(float bottom,
                        float left,
                        float width,
                        float height)
        Creates a new viewport for this based on the specified dimensions. These dimensions are in screen-space and must be in the [0, 1] range.
        Parameters:
        bottom - The relative starting position of the viewport's bottom edge, in screen-space.
        left - The relative starting position of the viewport's left edge, in screen-space.
        width - The how far to the right side the viewport's right border extends, in screen-space.
        height - The how far up the viewport's top border extends, in screen-space.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any values are outside the [0, 1] range.

      • getViewport

        Viewport getViewport(int index)
        Gets the viewport at the specified index, if it exists.

        Viewports are expected to be stored in the order in which they were created, so that the client can rely on that known order when requesting viewport references.

        Parameters:
        index - The zero-based index of the viewport.
        Returns:
        The viewport at the indexed position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is negative or greater than the number of viewports that have been created for this window.

      • getViewportCount

        int getViewportCount()
        Gets the current number of viewports this window has.
        Returns:
        The number of viewports.

      • getViewports

        java.lang.Iterable<Viewport> getViewports()
        Allows clients to iterate over all the viewports that have been added to this.
        Returns:
        An iterable of viewports.

      • removeViewport

        void removeViewport(int index)
        Removes the viewport at the specified index.

        Implementations are expected to invoke Disposable.notifyDispose() on the viewport.

        Parameters:
        index - The position of the viewport to remove.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is negative or greater than the number of viewports that have been created for this window.

      • removeViewport

        void removeViewport(Viewport vp)
        The viewport to be removed.

        Implementations are expected to invoke Disposable.notifyDispose() on the viewport.

        Parameters:
        vp - The viewport to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the viewport is null.

      • removeAllViewports

        void removeAllViewports()
        Removes all viewports.

        Implementations are expected to invoke Disposable.notifyDispose() on each viewport.

      • setTitle

        void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the specified title on the title bar.
        Parameters:
        title - The text to use as a title.

        Returns:
        The refresh rate, in Hertz.

      • isFullScreen

        boolean isFullScreen()
        Gets whether this render-window is in Full-Screen Exclusive Mode.
        Returns:
        true if this is in FSEM. Otherwise false.
